game

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • game.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.util.Observable
    A class representing a game board, used by the Game class. The board is represented as a native 2D array of custom objects. We use a fixed array because of the relative small size of the array and to keep things simplified. All public methods of this class working with coordinates assume board coordinates, allowing for negative integers. Internally, these are converted back to array coordinates starting at 0.
    Author:
    Jonathan Juursema & Peter Wessels

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Throws:
        SquareOutOfBoundsException - When a coordinate is out of bounds.

      • getMinMax

        public int[] getMinMax()
        Returns the minimal and maximal X and Y values that are occupied on the board.
        Returns:
        An array of integers, where the indexes map the values as follows: 0 > smallest X 1 > largest X 2 > smallest Y 3 > largest Y

      • getPossiblePlaceByTile

        public java.util.List<BoardSquare> getPossiblePlaceByTile(Tile tile)
                                                   throws SquareOutOfBoundsException
        This method returns the possible places on which the tile can be placed. The method uses the method getAllPossiblePlaces to return all the possible BoardSquares to place an tile.
        Parameters:
        tile - The tile on which the boardsquares can be placed.
        Returns:
        A list of boardsquares on which the tile can be placed.
        Throws:
        SquareOutOfBoundsException

      • getPossiblePlaceByTile

        public java.util.List<BoardSquare> getPossiblePlaceByTile(Tile tile,
                                                          java.util.List<Move> selectedMoves)
                                                   throws SquareOutOfBoundsException
        A method that returns all possible boardsquares on which the tile can be placed. The method determines the boardsquares with the list of moves. Because a set of moves can only be placed in the same row or column this is neccesary to validate a move (if the move is not the first move of a turn).
        Parameters:
        tile - The tile that needs to be placed on the board
        selectedMoves - The moves that are allready placed in the current turn.
        Returns:
        The list of boardsquares on which the tile can be placed.
        Throws:
        SquareOutOfBoundsException

      • getAllPossiblePlaces

        public java.util.Map<BoardSquare,java.util.List<Tile>> getAllPossiblePlaces()
                                                                     throws SquareOutOfBoundsException
        This function will retrieve all possible boardsquares on which a tile can be placed. The function returns a map which mapped the boardsquares to a list of possible tiles.
        Returns:
        A map with a boardsquare with potential tiles.
        Throws:
        SquareOutOfBoundsException

      • getPossiblePlacesByMoves

        public java.util.Map<BoardSquare,java.util.List<Tile>> getPossiblePlacesByMoves(java.util.List<Move> selectedMoves)
                                                                         throws SquareOutOfBoundsException
        This function returns possible places based on previous moves.
        Parameters:
        selectedMoves -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        SquareOutOfBoundsException

      • getPossiblePlacesBySquares

        public java.util.Map<BoardSquare,java.util.List<Tile>> getPossiblePlacesBySquares(java.util.List<Move> selected)
                                                                           throws SquareOutOfBoundsException
        Retrieve all possible places by the selected Moves
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Throws:
        SquareOutOfBoundsException

      • getPossiblePlaces

        public java.util.Map<BoardSquare,java.util.List<Tile>> getPossiblePlaces(java.util.List<Move> selected,
                                                                         boolean isRow,
                                                                         boolean isColumn)
                                                                  throws SquareOutOfBoundsException
        The main method with checks all the boardsquares that are selected and generates a map with relates an empty boardsquare to possible tiles that can be place.
        Parameters:
        selected - The selected moves
        isRow - If the moves form an row
        isColumn - Or if the moves form an column
        Returns:
        A map with boardsquares related to a list of tiles.
        Throws:
        SquareOutOfBoundsException
